item.title: Road between High Cross and Slutswell in terrible shape, 17th September
item.description:
The whole section is pitted with potholes and a broken road surface which for a major cycling route is extremely dangerous. This section is long overdue for repair having been in this state for a few years

item.title: Effluent from car wash pooling in gutter, 16th September
item.description:
Julian hand car wash on Swindon Road Cheltenham does not have sufficient drainage so effluent drains out onto the pavement and into the gutter where it pools into large puddles. There is a danger of being splashed in this effluent by passing traffic if you are using this part of the pavement. I fear this may turn icy in the winter causing a slip hazard also. I personally avoid this part of the pavement or change my route to avoid the possibility of being splashed in cleaning chemicals and god knows what else. I have reported this problem to Cheltenham borough council and the environment agency before but neither is interested saying its " Not their problem".
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 28 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped wooden boards and Tarpaulin, 14th September
item.description:
The location is the end of the woods on the Cleeve Common Road and opposite the Bill Smiley Butterfly Reserve - opposite the second layby with the waste bin in. To see the material - go towards the field via the track at the end of the woods, then turn right immediately as the material is hidden by the trees lining the road. Please can this be collected up as soon as possible so the AONB has one less mess in it..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree/roots damaged and knocked over breeze block wall, 14th September
item.description:
The boundary wall separating our property from the land adjacent to the M5 has been damaged by overgrown trees/roots and has fallen over leaving our property exposed to the motorway. The trees causing the damage are on the land between our boundary and the kulvert running alongside the M5 and are very overgrown and simply rebuilding the wall is not a viable solution. The blocked wall is only 3 courses high but it supports a wooden fence and I am obviously concerned that although this is still in place, it is no longer supported and will collapse leaving a considerable section of our boundary open.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Comus Bamfurlong Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 bollards snapped, 14th September
item.description:
Probably hit by a car or truck

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 62/66 Edinburgh Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedges etc Protruding into Gotherington Lane, 14th September
item.description:
From the house on Cleeve Road, Gotherington to the South side of The Lawns, the hedge protrudes out into Gotherington Lane by at least 600mm. This reduces the width of the road and forces cars out into the lane running North. It carries on until just after a derelict house. The extent of the hedges encroachment into the road is clearly shown where the drain access covers are now partially covered. The situation worsens as each year passes due to the failure to maintain the hedges.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Cleeve Road, Gotherington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Road Surface, 14th September
item.description:
The whole of Vale Road running East/West has dozens of raised manholes and a temporary surface. Which present a dangerous surface for cyclists and motor cyclists. Additionally, the junction with Gotherington Lane does not have any road signs or road markings.; There should be give way signs as well as standard road markings. It is a very dangerous road surface and accidents are inevitable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Homelands Commercial Centre VALE, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches obstructing footpath, 14th September
item.description:
Trees next to the road have some very low beaches. A resident hit their head. The trees is outside are in the verge between 95 and 97 Springbank Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 97 Springbank Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
